data.title: Time for talking
data.text: Bar was busy with business people for the after happy hour scene. They have weekday specials, had a 5 dollar burger basket. Took to long to get my "medium" burger that was burnt. My friend has some seasonal margarita concoction she loved it. I had a Cosmo. It was passable. I LOVED that the waitress wasn't pushing us to tab out. We got to sit for two hours and catch up. Maybe could have been in attentiveness, but I am being optimistic.

data.title: Graduation lunch
data.text: My daughter graduated in May so we decided to have lunch  after the graduation.  The meal was wonderful and not expensive.

data.title: "ChanEvan"
data.text:
Yes people:: From the time the Front Door hit you in the backside, it was very obvious that 

This is a  B. A. R. 

I have owned interest in Bars & Clubs, & the Barflies INSIST on fried greasy food.  That's just the nature of the beast who likes to wash it down with a few beers.

& Yeah it comes off the Sysco Truck -- what's wrong with that?

This may not be your date's 1st choice for an intimate Valentine's Dinner unless he/she is a never-wear-nuthin-but-jeans / beer-drinkin / honkey-tonkin pool shark.  (No offense meant -- Just Sayin there's different tastes for different types.)

So if you're all gussied up with visions of fine dining / white tablecloths / candles / flowers ~ Go on over to Omar's or the 501 & Enjoy.  

Efficient male server advised me::

(1) Drinks were half-price on Wednesday (Margaritas were small, but smooth -- without the bite) & 

(2) The Cajun Seafood Pasta I ordered had "Tony Chachere's heat."  I said "I like that, just not Too hot" -- & it was just right.  

A large portion of shrimp / scallops / crab / crawfish over bowtie pasta in an Alfredeaux sauce.  Comfort food.

I can't understand a diner who would not immediately send back cold food / rubbery pasta / etc.  The Server / Kitchen / Manager can only fix the things they know about.  

Why eat a badly-cooked meal in silence & then complain about it later to readers who can't re-write your night? 

The New Orleans Club decor & atmosphere complement the Cajun / Creole menu additions.  

Spacious / multi-level with balconies for smokers, there's a space to please everyone. 

Couldn't spot an unhappy face in the crowd.  

The locally-owned Brickhouse has nailed that down-home chill feelin that matches a casual relaxed mood.

data.title: Horrible Food!
data.text: Party of 20 arrived around 6:45 p.m. Waitress (Carly-SUPER!) took our drink orders; returned numerous times for refills.  Finally was able to place our food orders at 8:15 p.m. (see where I'm going with this!).  Drinks refilled numerous times but NO FOOD until 9:20!  Ordered seafood pastas that was not even lukewarm, noodles were stuck together and cheese on top was hard....Don't even think about getting the Shrimp dip appetizer...just cheese with shrimp seasoning...couldn't find the first piece of shrimp!  Tasted more like warm pimento cheese..NASTY!!!  $40 FOR TWO UNEATABLE DISHES....Take your money somewhere else along Main St.

data.title: Thumbs up
data.text: I like this place! Each time I have visited has been a good experience. The owner is very nice. I love the concert venue. There are a few placed to sit in the concert venue but the floor is pretty much open and I love that about it. They usually have pretty good bands playing there. I hope to visit again soon. As far as food goes, you get a LOT so it is definitely worth the money.  Great place, I recommend it!

data.title: BEST steak I've had in a long time!
data.text: Driving back from Florida we decided to stop in Jonesboro, AR for the night. I "googled" restaurants in the area and found this awesome place! Live music on the weekends and they had a steak special that was FABULOUS! The service was great too! I highly recommend this place. It is in downtown Jonesboro. With street parking, we had no problem finding a place to park and the short walk was nice after the FABULOUS dinner we had!

data.title: Fun place to eat
data.text:
I hope you enjoy this place as much as we did.  They have so much to offer (and I'm not even a drinker!): great food, multiple live performance stages, dueling pianos on one floor, a beer garden overlooking the rooftops of the more historic parts of town.   

The two dudes playing the day we were doing well with cover tunes.  
I loved my seafood stuffed steak!

data.title: Seafood pasta
data.text: The seafood pasta was excellent. It was filled with shrimp, crab, crawfish, scallops, and Bow tie pasta. The gator bites are something everyone needs to try. Our waitress was on top of our drink refills. Excellent service. Especially since it was a party of 12.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Good food, especially cajun..... great atmosphere. ... karaoke on Wednesday. .... hard parking just like rest of downtown area

data.title: Pretty Good!
data.text: Pretty good.  Not a restaurant that I would probably pick on my own, but I enjoyed myself.  We were upstairs and there is an outside balcony and access to the roof from the upstairs area.  The food we ordered was good and the service was good also.

data.title: Another great LOCAL downtown Jonesboro spot!
data.text: First, it has a great outside balcony/rooftop which is impossible to find here...the music that they bring in is incredible and it has a full bar with a full menu!

data.title: Great steak!!
data.text: In my opinion Brickhouse has the best filet in Jonesboro.  We have always been seated very quickly and the overall service is very good.  The price is quite high but I will splurge from time to time for the quality.

data.title: NACHOOOOOOOS
data.text: I go all the time to the Brick for their BBQ nachos! They are the best! It is a nice atmosphere with several TVs, music, and more! They have several levels of seating and even a room with ping pong and bean bag tosses. They have a beer garden open seaonal and several outside viewing spots.

data.title: Bar first, not a restaurant
data.text: Brickhouse changed their menu so its short, just one page, not as many options as before, and I feel they're really a bar first, that happens to have some food.  We got the nachos, which were really good, but my caesar salad was terrible, all wilty brown lettuce, and the gumbo was good, but cold cold cold.  The place is big so there's always somewhere to sit, before it turns into a hard core bar.  And there were lots of TVs for sports watching.  I don't think I'd go again though.

data.title: Worth stopping in!
data.text: Restaurant opens at five. We go there fifteen minutes early but they caught as we were walking away and said to come on in, close enough.  We sat outside in patio on third floor.  We had a couple mixed drinks, very tasty, appetizer, and dinner.  The appetizer was a smidge overdone but I have had it before; veey good usually (chicken and a slice of jalapeno wrapped in bavon and fried, bite sized....yum!).  The steak and ch ops were great!  We wre full!  They have live music at nights too.

data.title: Girls night out
data.text: My friends and I decided to go here for a girls night out.  The noise level was incredibly high as there were two different bands playing in an incredibly small space, we had an incredibly hard time hearing each other.  The food was ok but would not go back.  My waiter was also my cashier, I paid with cash and he did not bring me back my change.  Although the change wasn't a lot, it was the principle of the idea.  I considered that his tip.

data.title: good place
data.text: The place is fun and the food is very good.  What more can I say.  Try it, you won't be disappointed. The atmosphere is nice and service is great.

data.title: Great Food and Atmosphere
data.text: I love Brickhouse. I have eaten a lot of things from their menu. Every single item has been above average and well worth the money. I would suggest anyone who wants to have good food and a great night to go there.

data.title: Good food, nice staff, no waiting on a busy Saturday night
data.text: This place is large and has a good vibe to it. Clientele seemed mostly in their 20s and 30s but we found it very comfortable and we are in our 50s. We were seated immediately which is a rarity in Jonesboro on Sat night! Live entertainment was great. Food was good and reasonably priced. Staff was very nice. This was a great change from the chain restaurants we usually eat at. We will definitely be back!

data.title: Never ever again
data.text: The list of reasons I won't return is ridiculously long. Service, food, drinks......all poor. Environment filthy. I will not return.
